data.title: On This Day: On November 12, 1936, Eugene O’Neill was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature, to this day the only American playwright to...
data.meta_description:
30 likes, 1 comments - eugeneoneillnps on November 12, 2022: "On This Day:  On November 12, 1936, Eugene O’Neill was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature, to this day the only American playwright to receive the honor.  O’Neill received the news that he had won while he was briefly living in Seattle, WA.  O’Neill did not attend the ceremony in Stockholm the following month due to ill health, and just two weeks later he was admitted to Merritt Hospital in Oakland, CA with a burst appendix, where he remained for 10 weeks. 

O’Neill dedicated much of his acceptance speech to the profound influence on his work by Swedish writer August Strindberg.  The money awarded to O’Neill for his Nobel Prize was used to purchase the Tao House property in Danville, CA, now the site of the Eugene O’Neill National Historic Site. Visit www.nps.gov/euon for information on how to visit the site. 

#eugeneoneill #playwright #americanauthors #nobelprize #literature #dramaticart #alfrednobel #stockholm #sweden #auguststrindberg #merritthospital #oaklandca #carlottamonterey #taohouse #danvilleca #eastbay #nationalhistoricsite #seattlewa #nationalparkservice #theater #1936 #svenskaakademien #onthisday #smokinginthehospital

 
NPS Images:  Nobel Prize posters for 1936; Description:  Two color modern art prints with inscriptions in Swedish, translated as:  The Swedish Academy at its meeting of 12 November 1936, in accordance with the provisions of the will of Alfred Nobel of 1895, has determined to award the 1936 Nobel Prize for Literature to Eugene O’Neill, for his dramatic art characterized by power, honesty and strong emotion, together with depth of inspiration.  Stockholm 10 December 1936. 

Black and white photo of Eugene O'Neill in a hospital bed, smiling, smoking a cigarette, with a book on his chest.  1937; Photographer unknown.".
